newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mazda Motor expects group net loss for 96/97. [CORRECTED 04:05 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Mazda Motor expects group net loss for 96/97. [CORRECTED 04:05 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects headline and text to delete the word "heavy" in relation to the group net loss)
Mazda Motor Corp said on Friday that it expects a group net loss in the year ended March 31, 1997.
"We still expect to have a loss (in group results for 1996/97)," Gary Hexter, senior managing director in charge of business planning, told a news conference.
He declined to give a specific estimate.
Mazda is due to announce its 1996/97 group results next week.
Mazda expected its parent operating profit in 1997/98 to rise to 25 billion yen, said Keiichiro Yoshikawa, managing director of finance.
Mazda announced earlier on Friday an operating loss of 5.38 billion yen for fiscal 1996/97.
Yoshikawa also said Mazda will increase its parent capital investment sharply to 42 billion yen in 1997/98 from 21.5 billion yen in 1996/97.
Yoshikawa said the company plans to export 130,000 vehicles to the North American market in 1997/98, up from an actual 116,000 vehicles in 1996/97.
Mazda is one-third owned by Ford Motor Co.
